image.altText: Bruce Lehrmann arrives at court in Toowoomba in a black suit and light blue tie.

props.synopsis: It is the first time Mr Lehrmann has appeared personally at Toowoomba Magistrates Court since he was charged with two counts of rape in December 2022.

title.children: Former Liberal Party staffer Bruce Lehrmann arrives at court to face rape charges

image.altText: Anthony Albanese smiles as he puts his arm around Narendra Modi. Modi is making a fist. The background behind them is dark.

props.synopsis: The long arm of the Indian state is reaching Australians with threats against members of the Indian diaspora, the amassing of political power, and never-before-reported details of a "nest of spies".

title.children: When Australia quietly expelled four Indian spies, Modi's government thought it had avoided embarrassment

image.altText: Queensland State of Origin player Reece Walsh pumps his fist to a crowd in celebration during a football match

props.synopsis: Queensland names its squad for Origin II, with Selwyn Cobbo left out despite playing a crucial role in the Maroons' Origin I victory.

title.children: Maroons back Walsh at fullback after brutal concussion, as Slater forced into changes for Game II

image.altText: A house visible through trees and behind a picket fence

props.synopsis: A woman in her 80s and a man in his 60s, who police believe to be her son, have been killed in a house fire at Woodridge, south of Brisbane.

title.children: 'A terrible blow': Queensland's deputy premier pays tribute to mother and son killed in Logan house fire

image.altText: Life rings and water safety signs alongside a hotel pool.

props.synopsis: More than half of Australia's hotel pool drownings in the past decade happened in the Sunshine State where life rings, rescue tubes and defibrillators are not mandatory.

title.children: Queensland has Australia's most hotel pool drownings. Hoteliers call lifesaving devices impractical

image.altText: A long exposure shows a nuclear plant illuminated at night, with a white cloud of steam emerging from the top of two reactors.

props.synopsis: We asked Australia's largest energy companies, fund managers and a mining billionaire whether they think nuclear is a viable option for meeting our emissions targets — "unicorns" and "impossible without subsidies" were some of the responses we got back.

title.children: The Coalition says nuclear energy is 'commercially viable'. This is what the experts think

image.altText: An adult blonde male cartoon wearing khakis.

props.synopsis: One Nation published a two-minute video on Friday called 'The State of Queensland' which used Robert Irwin and popular children's character Bluey to mock the state government over perceived failings ahead of the election in October.

title.children: 'Own goal': One Nation mocks Robert Irwin's legal threat to sue over cartoon

image.altText: A crowd of people holding out bowls.

props.synopsis: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu criticises plans announced by the military to hold daily tactical pauses in fighting along one of the main roads into Gaza.

title.children: Israeli PM denounces tactical pauses in Gaza fighting to get in aid

image.altText: Protests CPH

props.synopsis: Supporters and protesters line the streets ahead of a highly anticipated meeting between Anthony Albanese and China's Premier Li Qiang. Follow live.

title.children: Scuffles break out between protesters as PM meets with Chinese premier

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Labor hopeful final trade barriers will be lifted
Barnaby Joyce wants the PM to reject new pandas
PM begins closed-door talks with Chinese premier

image.altText: Alex De Minaur

props.synopsis: Australia's Alex de Minaur climbs to seventh in the world rankings after beating Sebastian Korda in the Libema Open final.

title.children: De Minaur reaches career-high ranking after claiming victory in Dutch tournament

image.altText: A screenshot of a Coles loyalty points scam text message that asks customers to click on the link to redeem their points

props.synopsis: Scammers are using loyalty point programs as the latest way to try to trick you. To keep you safe, here are the common signs to watch out for.

title.children: Coles and Telstra are being impersonated by scammers. Here's how to spot a phishing scam

image.altText: Peter Dutton and Anthony Albanese cross paths in the House of Representatives.

props.synopsis: The past week has given us a taste of the degustation of political messages we are about to be bombarded with ahead of the next election. And it isn't pretty.

title.children: We've seen it in the US election, and now it's happening here. What is behind the rise of 'double haters'?

image.altText: Singer John Farnham standing next to his son Rob at his wedding. John is wearing a black suit while rob is wearing a cream suit

props.synopsis: After an oral cancer diagnosis in August 2022, John Farnham looks to be in good spirits with his family at his son's wedding.

title.children: John Farnham pictured at son's wedding in first images shared since cancer surgery

image.altText: The back of a blonde woman's head.

props.synopsis: After a stalker tracked Isla's car and bugged her home, she was given a similar tracking device. She wants all DV survivors to be offered one.

title.children: Isla is a DV survivor, so why does she take a tracking device everywhere she goes?

image.altText: Li Qiang and Anthony Albanese walk down a red carpet in front of ceremonial guards holding guns

props.synopsis: Anthony Albanese is expected to use a speech in front of China's Premier Li Qiang to declare that while the countries have some "competing views" there are opportunities to be found.

title.children: Albanese to tell Chinese premier Australia will not be 'silent' on disputes

image.altText: Bryson Dechambeau

props.synopsis: Bryson DeChambeau wins his second US Open title after a heartbroken Rory McIlroy stumbled on the final three holes.

title.children: Footage shows dejected McIlroy watching on after handing the US Open to American star

image.altText: A shark in the water close to an outboard engine.

props.synopsis: A professional fisherman says he is "racing" sharks almost every time he brings in his catch, and that shark numbers are making it almost impossible to fish in certain areas.

title.children: Sharks caught on camera taking fishers' catch raises concern about increased interaction

image.altText: An overturned yacht at sea.

props.synopsis: A father and son were winched to safety hours after the yacht they were on capsized off the coast of Bundaberg. Rescuers later recovered the body of a third man.

title.children: Sailor dies after yacht overturns off Queensland coast

image.altText: A primary school student receives a piece of toast with jam.

props.synopsis: As families struggle to keep their kitchens stocked, the cost-of-living crisis is drawing attention to the role of schools in providing healthy food to students — something that experts say also promotes their mental health.

title.children: This school is seeing more kids arrive without food. It's stepping in to help

image.altText: Composite image of Kyle Feldt, Alex Johnston and Tohu Harris

props.synopsis: Alex Johnston's 191st try in the NRL moves him past one rugby league legend and put another in his sights. Here are the biggest talking points from every game of round 15.

title.children: NRL Round-Up: Rabbit passes a legend to create history as wingers make the superhuman look normal

image.altText: A stock trader looks down at a tablet as he works on the floor of a busy stock exchange while surrounded by screens.

props.synopsis: While Wall Street enjoyed a strong week, a flat final session has left the ASX without much momentum. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: ASX set to slip as Wall St rally pauses, former AFL boss Gillon McLahlan to run Tabcorp

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Tabcorp appoints former AFL chief Gil McLaughlin as new CEO

image.altText: A photo of hand holding plastic pieces.

props.synopsis: Environment groups cleaning and re-cleaning remote northern Australian beaches of rubbish are calling on the federal government to do more to stop plastic being produced.

title.children: Australia considers mandating recycled plastic packaging as beaches drown in rubbish

image.altText: Latrell Mitchell of the Blues celebrates scoring a try

props.synopsis: Latrell Mitchell returns for NSW as coach Michael Maguire makes five changes to the Blues for Game II.

title.children: Latrell Mitchell is back for NSW as coach Maguire make several changes for Game II

image.altText: Prince William, Prince George, Princess Charlotte and Prince Louis

props.synopsis: Prince George, Princess Charlotte and Prince Louis post a touching Father's Day message for Prince William, sharing an image taken by Catherine, the Princess of Wales.

title.children: 'We love you, Papa': Touching Father's Day message to Prince William from the royal children

image.altText: A close of woman's hand holding paper birds

props.synopsis: Napapan Price turned to a skill she had picked up in childhood into a way to make everyone feel a little bit happier.

title.children: Battling loneliness in a new town, Napapan began folding paper birds

image.altText: Siddarth stands behind Chetna with his hand on her shoulder as they both look out the window of their partially built apartment.

props.synopsis: Multiple families say their dealings with the Victorian Managed Insurance Authority have been worse than the collapse of their builder.

title.children: It's been four years since this Victorian family's builder fled the country. Their home is still not finished

image.altText: A man on a bike rides past a wall, with a painting of the olympic rings on it.

props.synopsis: Organisers are putting the finishing touches on a sporting and cultural opus they hope will transform Paris and unite its residents — but for some, the Olympics are an expensive extravagance and something that must be stopped.

title.children: 'Brisbane, show the world what's happening': Paris has an Olympic warning for Australia

image.altText: Woman in purple shirt hugging woman in grey jumper on street

props.synopsis: Shelley and Jo are an unusual pair, but a chance meeting in a Brisbane car park changed their lives.

title.children: A chance meeting in a car park helped Shelley travel the 'long road' away from domestic violence

image.altText: An older man with grey hair siles at the camera wearing a brown suit and a blue patterened tie. He stands in a dimly lit room.

props.synopsis: Fry is a long-term campaigner for the sculptures to be returned and supports the British Museum displaying exact replicas made by a team of archaeologists who from 3D scans of the marbles.

title.children: 'There is a sacredness about the marbles': Why Stephen Fry thinks his country should return the Parthenon marbles

image.altText: Marcus Bontempelli, Nick Daicos and Dustin Martin

props.synopsis: Nick Daicos teaches a coaching icon a major lesson, Marcus Bontempelli continues his dominance, and a magical Dustin Martin milestone moment at the MCG.

title.children: AFL Round-Up: Bontempelli's masterpiece, Daicos's lesson to coaching icon and Dusty's magical milestone moment

image.altText: An artist impression of two large 21 storey towers

props.synopsis: The coastal city of Hervey Bay, a three-and-a-half hour drive north of Brisbane, is known for being a popular retirement location, whose residents enjoy a slower pace of life. But that could all change if plans for a $400 million, 21-storey resort are approved.

title.children: This planned luxury resort is endorsed by an Aussie celebrity, but do the residents of a relaxed, beachside city want it?
